oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PERIODIC WAVES SHOALING IN WATERS OViR STEEPLY SLOPING BOTTOMS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ayyar, Harihara Rama
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: steep bottom
sloping bottom
shoaling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The bottom bed slope plays a vital role m the shoaling and breaking of periodic waves. This study aims at the understanding of the effect of steep slopes (range steeper than 1 10) on the breaking point and the breaker trajectory and the point of impact. This range of slope is often met with in. the near-shore structures. Analytical investigations and model studies are outlined. The influence of slope on each of the significant breaker parameters is discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 12 (1970): Proceedings of 12th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Washington, D.C., 1970.; 22
